page.title: Static anode characteristic
page.description: Select a tube what do you want to use in your circuit. Look for a datasheet about this valve what contents a static anode characteristic and copy or print it. The static anode characteristics show anode current (Ia) on the y-axis, anode voltage (Ua) on the x-axis, and the set of curved lines shows the grid-to-cathode voltage (Ug).

page.title: The anode load line
page.description: Determine ideal values of the power supply voltage (Ups) and the anode resistor (Ra) from datasheet. Calculate Ia: Ia=Ups/Ra, and mark it on y-axis (A). Mark Ua=Ups point on x-axis (B). Join these two points up with a line.

page.title: Quiescent parameters
page.description: Select bias point of V1 valve as shown (left blue point). Read quiescent anode current (Ia0) from y-axis, anode voltage (V1 Ua0) from x-axis and grid voltage (V1 Ug0). Calculate and mark it V2Ua0 (V2Ua0=Ups-V1Ua0-(Ia*Ra)) on line of Ia0. (Ia0 is common). Read quiescent grid voltage of V2 (V2 Ug0).
